meanings.definition: To combine or impregnate with a salt or salts.
meanings.sent1: I will salify the soup by adding a pinch of salt.
meanings.sent2: After adding the seasoning, the dish will salify perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally salified the dessert, making it too salty.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to salify the atmosphere, creating tension.
meanings.sent5: The process of salifying the meat made it more flavorful.

meanings.definition: To become converted into a salt.
meanings.sent1: When mixed with water, the substance will salify.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the minerals in the rock will salify.
meanings.sent3: The potion unexpectedly caused the liquid to salify into crystals.
meanings.sent4: The once clear liquid began to salify, turning into a solid.
meanings.sent5: The chemical reaction caused the solution to salify rapidly.
